Defiition: AuthorID is a unique identifier for each name in the database (i.e., every author of every paper; the initial assumption of refnet's disambiguation algorithm is that all authors of all articles are different individuals).
Authors
Author Full Name

This indicates which names (i.e., AuthorID numbers) have been grouped together under a single groupID number because they are believed to be the same person. Because disambiguation is performed iteratively. The lowest authorID number in a group will always be used as the groupID.
The name under which the algorithm groups all of an author's putative name variants.
